title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire on Wednesday 4 May 2016 - BBC News

documents.title: man found with serious injuries in napton
text: a man has been found with serious head and spinal injuries .
the man , in his 40s , was found on a driveway on the butts , in napton on the hill , warwickshire , at about 18:30 on saturday .
police say it 's not known how the injuries occurred .
the man was taken to hospital and the police are appealing for anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: do n't miss election results
text: get the local election results as they happen on friday morning .
do n't miss our special @ twitterid local election updates early friday with @ twitterid @ 0030 , 0130 & 0230 # le2016
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: concern over plans for link road
text: luddington villagers are worried over plans for a 'stilted road ' to be built close to the racecourse in stratford .
the district council is planning to put in a relief road around stratford-upon-avon from the north to the a46 alcester road at wildmoor in the south of the town .
it 's to accommodate plans to build thousands of houses in the district .
the consultation into the plans ends on thursday 12 may .
you can hear more on the trish and jo breakfast show on bbc coventry and warwickshire tomorrow morning from 06:00 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: signalling problems causing delays
text: a signalling problem between birmingham international and birmingham new street is causing delays of up to 30 minutes to trains between these stations and in this direction , the national rail website reports .

documents.title: m42 delays - lane blocked
text: there 's a lane blocked and slow traffic on the m42 southbound between j5 , a41 ( solihull ) and j4 , a34 ( shirley ) , because of a broken down vehicle , bbc travel news reports .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: the latest news : fears for dhl jobs ; concerns over link road
text: these are some of the stories we are looking at today :
- unite is warning that dhl workers , many of them based in north warwickshire , could become victims as a result of bhs going into adminstration
- people living in south warwickshire have expressed concern about a proposed link road around stratford-upon-avon
- an appeal for information has been issued after a man was tied up during a robbery in coventry

documents.title: image of cannabis plants seized earlier
text: police have issued an drying cannabis plants seized in rugby today .
16 drying cannabis plants seized following warrant on st george 's avenue , rugby this morning
@ twitterid @ twitterid how much do you want for them ?

documents.title: man tied-up during coventry robbery
text: a man was bound with a laptop cable during a robbery at his coventry home .
the incident happened between 22:30 and 23:05 on wednesday 20 april when the 32-year-old answered the door to two men who threatened him with a hammer before demanding money .
they took £ 200 and $ 300 in cash from the man 's wallet before he managed to get free from the tied cable .

documents.title: holiday snaps found on memory stick
text: an appeal has gone out to return photos of an apparent family holiday found on a computer memory stick to the rightful owners .
warwickshire police took out a warrant on friday 22 april .
at a property in stratford-upon-avon .
amongst the items recovered was the computer memory stick - the family in the photos are not believed to be linked to the warrant .

documents.title: fears for future of dhl workers
text: sixty drivers and around 300 warehouse workers , many of them based at dhl logistics in atherstone , could become the latest victims of the failing high street chain bhs , which went into administration last week .
that 's according to the union , unite , whose members deliver goods to bhs 's 164 stores across the country .
dhl say it 's still in discussion with administrators and it would be premature to speculate on the long term impact .

documents.title: roll back the clock to the 1950 's
text: an exhibition exploring life in britain in the 1950 's is being prepared at compton verney in warwickshire .
it looks at how design shaped and influenced people 's lives in the years after the second world war .

text: these are some of the stories we 're looking at this afternoon :
police are investigating after a man was bound with a laptop cable during a robbery in coventry
- an appeal has been made to find the owner of a memory stick containing family photos recovered during a police operation
- it 's claimed a new housing plan could see councils in the west midlands worse off by millions of pounds

documents.title: five ways to get people back to the ballot box
text: it 's voting day in council and police crime commisioner elections tomorrow .
but fewer than 20 % of people have chosen to vote in council elections in some areas of england over the past four years .
news takes a look at five ways of getting people back to the ballot box .

documents.title: cannabis plants found in rugby
text: cannabis found in rugby after a police search .
warrant executed this morning on rugby town west area .
16 cannabis plants recovered .

documents.title: sir ranulph fiennes congratulates coventry explorer
text: a coventry explorer has been sent a message of congratulations by sir ranulph fiennes after trekking to the geographic north pole from the russian coastline .
mark wood and his team were there to find out how the arctic is changing and to provide educational material on climate change for schools .
his next planned expedition is to mount everest next year .

documents.title: weather : plenty of sunshine
text: this afternoon will remain dry with plenty of sunshine .
top temperature : 16c ( 61f )
the skies should remain largely clear overnight which , when coupled with light winds , will allow temperatures to dip , perhaps leading to a touch of frost in rural spots .
minimum temperature : 5c ( 41f )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: campaign starts for defibrillator outside pub
text: a campaign has been started to raise money to get a defibrillator installed outside a coventry pub .
it 's hoped the life-saving equipment can be placed outside the new spires pub , in grayswood avenue , allesley .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: man arrested after lorry death
text: a 54-year-old man has been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving after a lorry hit a van parked on a motorway hard shoulder .
the 55-year-old van driver died of his injuries at coventry 's university hospital after the crash on the m69 in leicestershire at about 15:15 on tuesday .

documents.title: wasps players dominate awards
text: wasps players are dominating the end-of-season awards in the aviva premierhship .
nathan hughes , charles piutau and george smith have all been shortlisted as the player of the year .
wasps and england centre , elliott daly , is nominated in the young player of the season award .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: housing plan 'could see councils worse off '
text: every council in the west midlands could be an average of £ 28m worse off if the government extends the right to buy scheme , according to the charity shelter .
they say plans to force local authorities to sell off the empty stock they own will also increase homelessness .

the charity 's toby lloyd says it 's affecting councils that still own their own houses the most : `` this just depends on how much council stock individual councils happen to have , so places that have a larger amount of council housing .
are just going to find themselves hit with a much bigger bill by the government '' .

documents.title: the latest news : drug dealer to repay half a million pounds ; school-boy suffers serious injury
text: these are some of our stories this lunchtime :
- a convicted drug dealer from warwickshire has been ordered to repay more than half a million pounds
- a north warwickshire schoolboy has been airlifted to hospital after a coach ran over his leg
- a campaign has started to get a potentially life-saving defibrillator installed outside a coventry pub

documents.title: slow traffic near hospital
text: car parking issues causing slow traffic near coventry 's university hospital .
slow moving traffic on ansty rd/clifford bridge rd towards university hospital entrance due to car parking issues.expect delays .

documents.title: plea to keep carnival alive
text: carnival organisers are appealing to people to help keep one of nuneaton 's longest traditions alive .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: boy suffers serious leg injuries
text: a schoolboy has suffered a serious leg injury after an accident in kingsbury .
schoolboy suffers serious leg injury

documents.title: drug dealer ordered to pay more than half a million pounds
text: a convicted drug dealer from warwickshire has been ordered to pay more than half a million pounds under the proceeds of crime act .
terence conlon , 41 , from snitterfield , is currently serving eight years in prison for importing cannabis .
under the proceeds of crime act the money is shared between the home office and the police .

documents.title: cole to leave the sky blues
text: coventry manager tony mowbray has confirmed midfielder joe cole will be leaving the club when his contract ends in the summer .
the 34-year-old will move to the north american soccer league side , tampa bay rowdies .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'amazing ' day at fundraising event
text: an `` amazing '' show of community spirit saw £ 15,000 raised in just one day as kind folk attempted to break a world record in nuneaton .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: pub to host life-saving equipment
text: a coventry pub could be the location for a potentially life-saving defibrillator if campaigners have their way .
it 's hoped the life-saving equipment can be placed outside the new spires pub on grayswood avenue in allesley .
a campaign to raise up to £ 2,000 to buy one has now got underway .
it 's in a very populated area , there 's shops nearby , there 's a couple of primary schools nearby and putting it outside a public house seems to be a great way of people knowing it 's there '' .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: the latest news : security warning over land rovers ; campaign for life-saving equipment at pub
text: these are some of the stories we are looking at this morning :
land rover defender owners are being warned to increase security after a rise in thefts
it 's claimed plans to make councils sell their empty housing stock could cost councils them an average of £ 28m .
- a campaign has been started to raise money to get a defibrillator installed outside a coventry pub .

documents.title: litterbug smokers face £ 400 bill for dropping cigarette ends
text: dropping cigarette ends and packets in coventry city centre could cost lazy smokers more than £ 400 each .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: watch : a look at the real-life locations which inspired peaky blinders
text: drama peaky blinders returns to bbc2 later this week .
the set designer says working on the programme , set in 1920s birmingham , has been a career highlight .
he shows us the scenes which have inspired him .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: speedway twins , 11 , representing gb
text: twins from atherstone , in north warwickshire , will be representing gb in speedway 's youth championships this weekend .
joe and dan thompson , aged 11 , are coventry mascots and will fly out to torun , in poland , tomorrow morning .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: engineering works lead to revised rail services
text: engineering works are causing a few revised rail services around coventry and warwickshire this morning .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: security warning over land rover defender thefts
text: drivers of land rover defenders are being advised to increase their security measures , because of a rise in thefts .
the call has come from warwickshire-based insurance firm nfu mutual , which says the west midlands is now the second worst place in the country for stolen defender claims .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast for coventry and warwickshire
text: find out what the weather has in store throughout the day .

documents.title: travel : slow traffic on a45
text: there 's slow traffic on the a45 stonebridge highway eastbound in coventry , at tollbar island in the roadworks area .
stay up to date with the latest disruption on the roads
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to our live feed on wednesday morning , bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet @ twitterid message via facebook .
